page.title: 10THE LADY WATERFORD HALL
page.content: THE LADY WATERFORD HALL The building which is now called the Lady Waterford Hall was built in 1860 to be the village school and it was used for that purpose until 1957. In 1862 Lady Waterford began covering the walls of the schoolroom with large paintings showing scenes from the bible.This task took her 21 years to complete.She took schoolchildren and estate workers as her models. The paintings were done in watercolour on paper stretched on wooden frames.Over the years the paintings have lost some of their original colour,but during recent years some have been professionally restored.To-day the building is used as a village hall where various village organisations regularly meet.It is also visited by many tourists each year.
